metadata.feature_description: Handle timezone conversions for page scheduling and dates

steps.action: Navigate to Pages module in PersonaBar and select Home page
steps.expected: Page details should load with Enable Scheduling toggle and date fields visible
steps.actual: Page details loaded successfully. Enable Scheduling toggle is On, Start Date shows 01/15/2026 10:30 PM, End Date shows 03/02/2026 05:00 PM. LT (Local Time) indicator visible.

steps.action: Modify Start Date day field from 15 to 20
steps.expected: Date field should accept the new value and Save button should become enabled
steps.actual: Date field updated to 01/20/2026. Save button enabled. 'Changes have not been saved' message appeared.

steps.action: Click Save button to save the modified date
steps.expected: Page should save successfully with the modified date
steps.actual: Page saved successfully. 'Page updated successfully' message displayed. Save button disabled after save.

steps.action: Navigate away from Home page (to Our Products) and return to Home page
steps.expected: Start Date should correctly display the saved value (01/20/2026) after retrieval
steps.actual: After navigating back to Home page, Start Date correctly displays 01/20/2026 10:30 PM. The FixTimeZone method in EvoqPagesController.cs properly converts dates with DateTimeKind.Unspecified to UTC and back to local time for display.

observations: The FixTimeZone method in Services/EvoqPagesController.cs handles timezone conversion by specifying DateTimeKind.UTC for dates with DateTimeKind.Unspecified
UTC storage verification is a backend operation - UI testing confirms dates display correctly in local time format (LT indicator visible)
Daylight saving time handling is implicitly covered by the UTC conversion mechanism - dates near DST boundaries would use the same FixTimeZone logic
The scheduling date picker shows 'LT' (Local Time) indicator, confirming timezone-aware display
